name: The Louvre
description: The Louvre is the world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, France. It houses a vast collection of art and antiquities, including the famous Mona Lisa.

exhibitions.title: Egyptian Antiquities
exhibitions.description: A rich collection of Egyptian artifacts and treasures.

exhibitions.title: Italian Renaissance
exhibitions.description: Features works from Da Vinci, Michelangelo, and other Italian masters.

name: The British Museum
address: Great Russell St, Bloomsbury, London WC1B 3DG, UK
description: The British Museum in London is dedicated to human history, art, and culture, and it houses over eight million works from all continents.

exhibitions.title: Ancient Greece
exhibitions.description: A look at the life and culture of ancient Greece.

exhibitions.title: Rosetta Stone
exhibitions.description: One of the museum's most famous artifacts, the key to understanding Egyptian hieroglyphs.

name: The Metropolitan Museum of Art
description: The Met is the largest art museum in the United States, showcasing over 5,000 years of art from every corner of the globe.

exhibitions.title: Arms and Armor
exhibitions.description: A collection of historic armor and weapons from across the world.

exhibitions.title: European Paintings
exhibitions.description: Masterpieces from the European Renaissance to the 19th century.

name: Rijksmuseum
description: The Rijksmuseum is a Dutch national museum dedicated to arts and history in Amsterdam. It is best known for its collection of Dutch Golden Age paintings.

exhibitions.title: Rembrandt
exhibitions.description: A showcase of works by Rembrandt van Rijn.

exhibitions.title: Dutch Masters
exhibitions.description: Artworks from the Dutch Golden Age, including Vermeer and Frans Hals.

name: State Hermitage Museum
description: The Hermitage Museum in St Petersburg, Russia, is one of the largest and oldest museums in the world, housing over three million items, including the largest collection of paintings.

exhibitions.title: Russian Art
exhibitions.description: Explore the history and development of Russian art.

exhibitions.title: Western European Art
exhibitions.description: An extensive collection of European masterpieces from the Renaissance to the 19th century.
